defs: (dial.) absence or want of right or natural condition.
= ಉಪರಾಟಿ.
a person acting as a deputy or or sometimes substitute for, an ambassador; a deputy ambassador.

the elected officer in the Indian governmental system, acting as the Chairman of the Rājya Sabhā and succeeding to the Presidency in the event of the President's death, incapacity or removal; Vice President (as in India or similar officer elsewhere).
situated, coming, placed or supposed to be, above.
the upper portion or region.
the excess quantity; the quantity by which one exceeds another.
afterwards; (immediately) following (in time).
one who moves in the sky; a god or demigod etc.
an animal that lives on the surface of another animal whether parasitically or commensally; epizoon.
a more than sufficient quantity or number; the state or quality of being so.

of the region above; placed, situated, belonging to, a higher place or region above.
the region above (something).
the deciding vote cast by the presiding officer when the voting on both sides is equal; the casting vote.
the plane surface above (something).

any of the regions or worlds, believed to be situated above our earth.

an epicycle - a) (astron.) a circle whose centre moves along the circumference of another, larger circle; b) (geom.) a circle which, by rolling around the interior or exterior of another circle, generates a hypocycloid or epicycloid respectively.
(geom.) the curve traced by a point on the circumference of a circle that rolls around the outside of a fixed circle; a epicycloid.

a flower (as sunflower) having the ovary completely enclosed in the receptacle and the stamens, sepals, etc., situated above it; epigyny.
that which is hidden, concealed or kept secret.

ಉಪವಾಸ ಕೆಡವು upavāsa keḍavu to deny another his/her food (as a punishment); ಉಪವಾಸಬೀಳು upavāsa bīḷu to suffer from hunger; ಉಪವಾಸಮಾಡು upavāsa māḍu to abstain from taking food; to fast; ಉಪವಾಸಮುಗಿಸು upavāsa mugisu to break the fast, esp. the one taken as a vow or in protest against something; ಉಪವಾಸವಿರು upavāsaviru to be fasting.

a form of protest in which a person refuses to take food until certain demands are met; hunger strike.

a person deliberately abstaining from taking food.

a modern movement in art and literature, in which an attempt is made to portray or interpret the workings of the unconscious mind as manifested in dreams: it is characterised by an irrational, fantastic arrangement of material; surrealism.
